intro: Samolus geniculatus, commonly known as the zigzag sedge, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, triangular stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in spikelets. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds. Samolus geniculatus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
